document.title: New Jersey Core Curriculum Content Standards for Health and Physical Education Standards

7ECA955B686240118ED72797EAA889E2.description: Develop a fitness goal and monitor progress towards achievement of the goal.

C4908CD8DF04408BB480F696420DF33A.description: Explain what it means to be physically fit and engage in moderate to vigorous age-appropriate activities that promote fitness.

9B422948921148FFADFBB1F0864D0ADC.description: Explain the role of regular physical activity in relation to personal health.

30A1CC1E0E884D1B9492C29DD6889357.description: Appropriate types and amounts of physical activity enhance personal health.

16B116EDA2F7498CBD9D7D820577B163.description: Fitness: All students will apply health-related and skill-related fitness concepts and skills to develop and maintain a healthy, active lifestyle.

C89962C061964A03B3050F2FA7AD5DDE.description: Demonstrate appropriate behaviors and safety rules and explain how they contribute to moving safely during basic activities.

2DFBCBA02E1E4DC4BD4D85C0CE5E57D3.description: Explain what it means to demonstrate good sportsmanship.

32E5CD30ECBF464F92001068072C393D.description: Practicing appropriate and safe behaviors while participating in and viewing games, sports, and other competitive events contributes to enjoyment of the event.

82774CFAA9A0453591C9C4F6CDD75A6C.description: Demonstrate strategies that enable team and group members to achieve goals.

CBA4A096AD204D9B9576EF32109F3C73.description: Determine how attitude impacts physical performance.

07D4BB6B4300490EA3174028A848A5C3.description: Explain the difference between offense and defense.

62D09DFA726240478C7E09AF0F7A4444.description: Differentiate when to use competitive and cooperative strategies in games, sports, and other movement activities.

F20B9EC81B7D457C9E05FE62D24835DC.description: Teamwork consists of effective communication and other interactions between team members.

B90FDC5CF75F4E288A089F03DB12CB47.description: Correct movement errors in response to feedback.

501BD453CC584049AAE7C32221921A1C.description: Respond in movement to changes in tempo, beat, rhythm, or musical style.

9FCF751B217644109FED98458CA7E2C7.description: Demonstrate changes in time, force, and flow while moving in personal and general space at different levels, directions, ranges, and pathways.

33A7522F73CD4439A335D489CAF210D2.description: Explain and perform movement skills with developmentally appropriate control in isolated settings (i.e., skill practice) and applied settings (i.e., games, sports, dance, and recreational activities).

3A800B3690084739A64344C55202D9CD.description: Understanding of fundamental concepts related to effective execution of actions provides the foundation for participation in games, sports, dance, and recreational activities.

66827CFEA0BD43D590D5E41E329E8AE4.description: Motor Skill Development: All students will utilize safe, efficient, and effective movement to develop and maintain a healthy, active lifestyle.

AE6E773C5D98418B903218A5E050B037.description: Explain the factors that contribute to a mother having a healthy baby.

809882A1641E48E6B13ADF5AD94F799D.description: The health of the birth mother impacts the development of the fetus.

A643DA1BF3454F4F9B6E2085404D40E4.description: Compare and contrast the physical differences and similarities of the genders.

2D0AF5525E7B4305B1B347F4A67F255C.description: Gender-specific similarities and differences exist between males and females.

41799E4BBA1443029BE5A856DB30BDAE.description: Determine the factors that contribute to healthy relationships.

E8B9BCC77990488DA386B8A0BDC1723E.description: Distinguish the roles and responsibilities of different family members.

5DCA1A941DB6436FA52F1E250D1FAC9C.description: Compare and contrast different kinds of families locally and globally.

BA8C6C3A1AFB4AEAB1831010B5CA114C.description: The family unit encompasses the diversity of family forms in contemporary society.

E360AC91170B41F5BFA01B10C049D1AB.description: Human Relationships and Sexuality: All students will acquire knowledge about the physical, emotional, and social aspects of human relationships and sexuality and apply these concepts to support a healthy, active lifestyle.

6B226F2B7CD944179CABCEBF7CD7D197.description: Explain that people who abuse alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs can get help.

FD83303A874247A09375544AB78FC837.description: There are many ways to obtain help for treatment of alcohol, tobacco, and other substance abuse problems.

92CDD9B2F1AF4820B06769EB3596207E.description: Recognize that some people may have difficulty controlling their use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F0E94D9E7D8649859BCAEE78CCD4467E.description: Substance abuse is caused by a variety of factors.

DC2CA498CA104C339BC0269D044E8DBD.description: List substances that should never be inhaled and explain why.

D2ED86D278534B4FA24C9A5EE39ADD7C.description: Explain why tobacco smoke is harmful to nonsmokers.

8EA6A511A46D4889BA12E690B5F2591A.description: Explain effects of tobacco use on personal hygiene, health, and safety.

DB9DC13BC2D147EB938F0941C598DDF5.description: Identify ways that drugs can be abused.

5FB4112A60DF42B0A37DF2C3C95036E4.description: Use of drugs in unsafe ways is dangerous and harmful.

190CFEF3849D4809875855BFA9353409.description: Explain why medicines should be administered as directed.

8C8C09F720384FC9A3188B04D78703C2.description: Explain what medicines are and when some types of medicines are used.

D7A4C2D316124425AEFBB2A12932DD42.description: Medicines come in a variety of forms (prescription medicines, over-the-counter medicines, medicinal supplements), are used for numerous reasons, and should be taken as directed in order to be safe and effective.

7360E20FB2C84389BEF34538BD43AC5D.description: Drugs and Medicines: All students will acquire knowledge about alcohol, tobacco, other drugs, and medicines and apply these concepts to support a healthy, active lifestyle.

A24CAB707D0A42E5AF7E53CAD722DB74.description: Determine where to access home, school, and community health professionals.

D5C170503CD6480FB1263EE91CE15A6E.description: Knowing how to locate health professionals in the home, at school, and in the community assists in addressing health emergencies and obtaining reliable information.

40F9FDD340B84F4BB6129AD1DB7D796E.description: Determine the benefits for oneself and others of participating in a class or school service activity.

43D2ED02D45A492E8C3CEFAB6A362CE9.description: Service projects provide an opportunity to have a positive impact on the lives of self and others.

8927F2E7E38C4D51962A3D7D3E0D019E.description: Identify types of disabilities and demonstrate appropriate behavior when interacting with people with disabilities.

1142BDD83B514A1EBFCA2001D9D05DD1.description: Explain the meaning of Character and how it is reflected in the thoughts, feelings, and actions of oneself and others.

FEEB9A9C3243484B9B5813A2126DED12.description: Character traits are often evident in behaviors exhibited by individuals when interacting with others.

5B646AEA9AF84AA890E482A941FBDD9A.description: Select a personal health goal and explain why setting a goal is important.

A75C2A01174D4E3ABF0CE230E246F348.description: Determine ways parents, peers, technology, culture, and the media influence health decisions.

389E2F5840854C9DB57ECEC530265327.description: Relate decision-making by self and others to one's health.

47AE9DF2251D4A9599CA0F0F2F54DF0D.description: Explain what a decision is and why it is advantageous to think before acting.

E7E296A694B14A32BB6E462069BD6000.description: Effective decision-making skills foster healthier lifestyle choices.

FCA03162B2BF456F946258E4E6053428.description: Express needs, wants, and feelings in health- and safety-related situations.

B05ED67B50A848A0A4B1A6E9F5DED55F.description: Effective communication may be a determining factor in the outcome of health- and safety-related situations.

AC643CDA73C342409569ABF8D38ED61A.description: Integrated Skills: All students will develop and use personal and interpersonal skills to support a healthy, active lifestyle.

FA044898A19B4A2D9FE07E3700298A6E.description: Explain healthy ways of coping with common stressful situations experienced by children.

03DD0F2E511E44FB85F7846EBA36CFA4.description: Determine possible causes of conflict between people and appropriate ways to prevent and resolve them.

CB2EE66C82C640A5B1A9461BAC26D12C.description: Identify basic social and emotional needs of all people.

774A5BC45C4049A2BA6D91BC40735665.description: Many factors at home, school, and in the community impact social and emotional health.

D226980E76C3427C941537307562EB94.description: Identify procedures associated with pedestrian, bicycle, and traffic safety.

19DE1895916D4B87957D123275FE7219.description: Differentiate among the characteristics of strangers, acquaintances, and trusted adults and describe safe and appropriate behaviors/touches.

8D55D29EFE7C497897B3E2B61B2FB167.description: Identify ways to prevent injuries at home, school, and in the community (e.g., fire safety, poison safety, accident prevention).

F827CA4F2ED946B2B2E48961FF0159EE.description: Using personal safety strategies reduces the number of injuries to self and others.

C5BEC2323E6F4C60A8C183C5B672320E.description: Determine how personal feelings can affect one's wellness.

239176CE95844EB888B6EFFABA255391.description: Summarize strategies to prevent the spread of common diseases and health conditions.

3AE822E015C84CE19A8AC5EDFB2D5567.description: Summarize symptoms of common diseases and health conditions.

D0038B6F7D024119B91D4F5CA95A212A.description: Knowledge about diseases and disease prevention promotes health-enhancing behaviors.

B57686736CB246798365A130D3A744E6.description: Summarize information about food found on product labels.

8B1B571E082147468490FE718DD634ED.description: Explain how foods on MyPlate differ in nutritional content and value.

179F8EA7DC994F1C87120A39077F72D7.description: Explain why some foods are healthier to eat than others.

B0E7E994AD2B419B970290CB4F0A112F.description: Choosing a balanced variety of nutritious foods contributes to wellness.

FC0BF1CCFD5A4A76B14887BA3C09331A.description: Use correct terminology to identify body parts, and explain how body parts work together to support wellness.

11FFBAF14CE6471CB60E32D1177F906F.description: Explain what being "well" means and identify self-care practices that support wellness.

6AEA08DE7C6248DC872BC6AD5EDBEB9D.description: Wellness: All students will acquire health promotion concepts and skills to support a healthy, active lifestyle.
